questions.question: 1. Which of the following is not an array?

explanations.a: All the elements are of the same type (integer).
explanations.b: This option contains a mix of different types such as strings and boolean values.
explanations.d: All the elements are boolean values.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following is an array sorted in descending order?

explanations.a: -8 and -17 must be swapped as -8 > -17 and -14 > -17.
explanations.b: This array is in ascending order. It must be reversed to be the correct answer.
explanations.d: This sequence is in descending order.

questions.question:
3. Consider the following arrays:
A = [5, -5, 10, 1]
B = [0, 100, 1, 0]
Which of the following arrays represents the combination of the 2 arrays in a sorted order(assume ascending order)?

explanations.a: This answer simply involves combining the two arrays one after the other (here B after A). This array is not sorted in ascending order.
explanations.b: This answer simply involves combining the two arrays one after the other (here A after B). This array is not sorted in ascending order.
explanations.c: -5 must come right at the beginning of the array as -5 < 0 and -5 < 1.
explanations.d: This array is the right combination of the two arrays in ascending order as all elements are present from both the arrays in a sorted order.
